common package

decorator.py

This is the module that defines the decorator.

process_time(print_func=<built-in function print>)[source]

Prints the processing time.

Parameters:

print_func (Callable) –

standard output function.

print() or logging (.debug, .info, … ) etc…

Returns:

Callable – _process_time function in this function.

@process_time(print_func=print)
def func():
    ...
    return rtn

# # [START] ========================================
#   ...
# # ================================================
# # 12.345678sec
# # [END] ==========================================
save_params_log(fname='log_params.yaml')[source]

Saves parameters.

  • The execution start date and time, end date and time, and processing time are also saved.

  • The return value of the function to which the decorator is applied is assumed to be a dictionary. If it is not a dictionary type, it will not be saved.

  • If the dictionary key has “result” (data save directory path), it will be saved in that directory. If not, it saves it in the current directory.

Parameters:

fname (str) – file (The extension is .yml, .yaml, .json, .toml.)

Returns:

Callable – _save_params_log function in this function.

@save_params_log(fname='log.yaml')
def func(params):
    ...
    return params

params = {
    'aaa': 'abc',
    'bbb': 1,
    'ccc': [1],
    'ddd': [1, 2],
    'result': 'path/to/dir',
}
func(params=params)

Output (path/to/dir/log.yaml):

aaa: abc
bbb: 1
ccc:
- 1
ddd:
- 1
- 2
result: path/to/dir
start_datetime: 2024-1-1 00:00:00.000000
end_datetime: 2024-1-1 00:00:12.345678
process_time: 12.34567891234567

class ParamLog(SH='sh', FH='fh', NAME='main', FPATH='log/log.txt', SIZE=1000000, NUM=10)[source]

Bases: object

Defines the parameters used in the logging configuration.

This function is decorated by @dataclass.

SH = 'sh'
FH = 'fh'
NAME = 'main'

The name to pass to logging.getLogger.

Type:

str

LEVEL = {'fh': 10, 'sh': 10}

Log level.

  • key=sh: stream handler.

  • key=fh: file handler.

Type:

ClassVar[dict[str, int]]

FPATH = 'log/log.txt'

File path.

Type:

str

SIZE = 1000000

Max file size.

Type:

int

NUM = 10

Number of files.

Type:

int

log.py

This is the module that sets the logging configuration.

class SetLogging(logger, param)[source]

Bases: object

Sets the logging configuration.

Parameters:

  • logger (Logger) – logging.Logger

  • param (ParamLog) – lib.common.define.ParamLog

format = <logging.Formatter object>

Log format.

Type:

logging.Formatter

set_level()[source]

Sets the log level.

  • Run logging.Logger.setLevel().

set_stream_handler()[source]

Sets the stream handler configuration.

  • Set the log level. (logging.StreamHandler.setLevel())

  • Set the log format. (logging.StreamHandler.setFormatter())

  • Add the handler. (logging.Logger.addHandler())

set_file_handler()[source]

Sets the file handler configuration.

  • Set the file path, size, and number. (logging.RotatingFileHandler)

  • Set the log level. (logging.RotatingFileHandler.setLevel())

  • Set the log format. (logging.RotatingFileHandler.setFormatter())

  • Add the handler. (logging.Logger.addHandler())

This is the module that defines the common process.

seed (int) – random seed.

recursive_replace(data, fm_val, to_val)[source]

Performs a recursive replacement.

Parameters:

  • data (Any) – data before replacement.

  • fm_val (Any) – value before replacement.

  • to_val (Any) – value after replacement.

Returns:

Any – data after replacement.
